snippet: In his first overseas trip as defense secretary, Chuck Hagel landed Friday in Afghanistan, where 66,000 American troops continue to experience what he described as “the heat of battle.”
abstract: Chuck Hagel arrives in Afghanistan in his first overseas trip as defense secretary; says significant focus of visit will be assessing plans for transferring responsibility for security to Afghan government by time combat mission expires in 2014.

byline.contributor: Rod Nordland and Azam Ahmed contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In his first overseas trip as defense secretary, Chuck Hagel landed Friday in Afghanistan, where 66,000 American troops continue to experience what he described as “the heat of battle.”

headline.seo: Hagel Arrives in Afghanistan to Assess ‘Reality of Combat’
headline.main: New Defense Chief Visits ‘Reality of Combat’ in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: New Defense Secretary Checks on Transition in Afghanistan
